It is a bit cheaper if I pay for it on an annual basis right?Wondering what are the pros and cons to paying for premiums monthly vs annual, and what payment methods do you guys use? Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 29 Nov 2018Annual is cheaper for traditional, non ILP products. Do note some insurers don't accept credit card payments after issuance (like on my side) 0 comments0
Good Day Every DayLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 28 Nov 2018You should pay annually for the insurance premiums as it is definitely cheaper. 0 comments0

Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered on 28 Nov 2018Yes you usually get a 2-3% discount when paying annually. Plus if you're paying with credit card for your first year, you can utilise your CC benefits.In fact, some banks even allow you to split your yearly payments to months with no cost, so that's a easy way to save some money on your first year premium. 0 comments0
